author: Staff Reporter
text:
Two motorbikes that were parked in the portico of a house in Arcot Town went up in flames on Wednesday night.

According to police, Badrinath (49) was a tenant in the ground floor of a house on Bharathiar Street, Devi Nagar, Arcot, while another tenant was residing on the first floor of the house. Their two-wheelers were parked in the portico. Mr. Badrinath was a district-level functionary of MDMK.

At about 10.30 p.m. on Wednesday, the two vehicles suddenly went up in flames. The fire damaged the ceiling of the portico. While they along with neighbours tried to put off the fire, personnel of the Fire and Rescue Services were also called.

On Thursday, Mr. Badrinath lodged a case with the Arcot Town police. In the complaint, he stated that the vehicles went up in flames and were destroyed. However, he said he did not suspect any foul play. Police said it could have been caused by fuel leakage, and have registered a case of accidental fire.
title: Bikes parked in a house go up in flames
